text: BREAKING News Out Of Colorado!!!
BOOM!

Very Proud of these young men and women, taking
a stand against their generations stupidity!

High school students in Colorado feeling silenced
by the many pro-gun control rallies across

the nation following the Florida school shooting
decided to hold a walkout supporting the Second
Amendment.

Students at Woodland Park High School, an
hour north of Pike’s Peak, began the 30-minute

pro-Second Amendment rally with a moment of
silence for victims of past school shootings,
Fox News reports.

One of the student organizers, Christian Garcia,
told FOX 21 why it’s so important to hold
events like this.

“If we have more armed officers or some
type of security at our school and teachers

train more, that will honestly stop or prevent
school shootings a lot more,” Garcia said.

“I don’t believe that guns are the problem,
I think it’s more of the people and that

people are trying to blame an inanimate object
for something that’s not them.”
~ Student Haley Armstead

These students need commended for being able
to take a stand against other students that
are against their beliefs.
“I’m pro-Second Amendment.

I wouldn’t mind deeper background checks,
of course, but the Second Amendment will not
be infringed upon,” said student Anna Delaney.

Many Rockledge High School students participated
in the original walkout two weeks ago—but

Delaney and Chloe Deaton decided to organize
the Friday rally.

These High School Students walked onto the
school’s track carrying the American flag

and holding signs that read “guns don’t
kill people, people kill people” and “I
support the right to bear arms.”

“It’s all over the news right now that
all students hate guns, I wanted to show that
not all students feel that way.”
~ High School Student Zachary Schneider

Blunt Truth for the ignorant fools who believe
the propaganda and are going after firearms:

There is no such thing as an, “Assault Weapon”
and these ignorant fools who keep spouting

the propaganda to scare the sheep into submission,
need to be fought on every level.

The weapon is the TOOL that is picked for
use by the criminal (whether the tool be a
gun, car, screwdriver, knife, etc.).

The ASSAULT is the act of the criminal doing
the damage with the chosen tool.
what do you think about this?
